mdRecord.dcterms:title: When this cruel war is over
Dearest Love, do you remember!
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Sawyer, Charles Carroll. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Civil War song sheet in 4 verses with chorus; without music. Printed in black on unruled paper. [original]
First line: Dearest love, do you remember! [original]
Charles Magnus published as an individual at 12 Frankfort St., New York, between 1860 and 1867. Works which also include Washington, D.C. imprint were published about 1863 and 1864. [original]

Hand-colored headpiece of a woman standing on a stage, the whole enclosed in a single rule border. Magnus 215. Cf. American song sheets. Bibliographic description does not match any of the Magnus printings described in the bibliography. [original]
SPECIAL COLLECTIONS: Nineteenth of 25 song sheets which were mounted in an unidentified scrapbook. Rehoused, 2009. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: War songs--United States--Texts
